isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING CUMMINS M11 & N14 ELECTRONIC ENGINE SYSTEM - DIAGNOSTICS AND TROUBLESHOOTING - HELLA RELAY

svcproc.title: HELLA RELAY
svcproc.para: International circuits use suppressedHella relays for controlling power to load devices. The suppression feature (a resistor circuit parallel to the relay coil) prevents voltage spikes from damaging electronic components in the vehicle. These relays must be replaced with the correct International part.

Relays used in exposed areas such as the engine compartment are sealed relays and are a different part number than those in the cab. The part number is embossed on the relay. There is also a circuit diagram of the relay located on the relay body. The terminals are numbered on the relay in the same manner as in the circuit diagrams. To test the relay, refer to Testing Relay.
